availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George R. Thompson (Todd County, KY, clerk and private)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Matthew and Jane Thompson. Student in Todd County in 1850. Clerk in Todd County in 1860. Served in 2nd Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as private from 1861 to 1864. Captured near Cleveland, Tennessee on November 24, 1863. Appeared on a register of prisoners of war leaving the Military Prison, Louisville, Kentucky, for Rock Island Barracks, Illinois, on December 11, 1863. Died of smallpox on March 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 1, p. 196B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 697.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
